revised_title: The Royal Society Archives Cataloging Project
tldr: This article discusses the process of cataloging the Royal Society's archives, which involves sorting and listing the contents of various receptacles under general heads before proceeding with a document-by-document listing. The article also mentions the financial assistance received from the Pilgrim Trust to support the project and the consultative panel appointed to advise on the cataloging of the archives.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archival Studies
